Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: צַ֤ו אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הָעֹלָ֑ה הִ֣וא הָעֹלָ֡ה עַל֩ מוֹקְדָ֨ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ כָּל־הַלַּ֨יְלָה֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר וְאֵ֥שׁ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ תּ֥וּקַד בּֽוֹ׃
Translit: tṣav ʾeth-ʾaharōn vəʾeth-bānāv lēʾmōr zōʾth tōrath hāʿōlāh hivʾ hāʿōlāh ʿal mōqədhāh ʿal-hammizbēaḥ kol-hallaylāh ʿadh-habbōqer vəʾēsh hammizbēaḥ tūqadh bō
English: Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt offering: It is the burnt offering, because of the burning upon the altar all night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.

Hebrew: וְלָבַ֨שׁ הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִדּ֣וֹ בַ֗ד וּמִֽכְנְסֵי־בַד֮ יִלְבַּ֣שׁ עַל־בְּשָׂרוֹ֒ וְהֵרִ֣ים אֶת־הַדֶּ֗שֶׁן אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאכַ֥ל הָאֵ֛שׁ אֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְשָׂמ֕וֹ אֵ֖צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vəlāvash hakkōhēn middō vadh ūmikhnəsē-vadh yilbash ʿal-bəsārō vəhērîm ʾeth-haddeshen ʾasher tōʾkhal hāʾēsh ʾeth-hāʿōlāh ʿal-hammizbēaḥ vəsāmō ʾētṣel hammizbēaḥ
English: And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.

Hebrew: וּפָשַׁט֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְלָבַ֖שׁ בְּגָדִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְהוֹצִ֤יא אֶת־הַדֶּ֨שֶׁן֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָהֽוֹר׃
Translit: ūfāshaṭ ʾeth-bəghādhāv vəlāvash bəghādhîm ʾaḥērîm vəhōtṣîʾ ʾeth-haddeshen ʾel-miḥūtṣ lammaḥaneh ʾel-māqōm ṭāhōr
English: And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

Hebrew: וְהָאֵ֨שׁ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ תּֽוּקַד־בּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א תִכְבֶּ֔ה וּבִעֵ֨ר עָלֶ֧יהָ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן עֵצִ֖ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וְעָרַ֤ךְ עָלֶ֨יהָ֙ הָֽעֹלָ֔ה וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלֶ֖יהָ חֶלְבֵ֥י הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
Translit: vəhāʾēsh ʿal-hammizbēaḥ tūqadh-bō lōʾ thikhbeh ūviʿēr ʿālehā hakkōhēn ʿētṣîm babbōqer babbōqer vəʿārakh ʿālehā hāʿōlāh vəhiqṭîr ʿālehā ḥelvē hasshəlāmîm
English: And the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put out: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace offerings.

Hebrew: אֵ֗שׁ תָּמִ֛יד תּוּקַ֥ד עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לֹ֥א תִכְבֶֽה׃
Translit: ʾēsh tāmîdh tūqadh ʿal-hammizbēaḥ lōʾ thikhveh
English: The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out.

Hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַמִּנְחָ֑ה הַקְרֵ֨ב אֹתָ֤הּ בְּנֵֽי־אַהֲרֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vəzōʾth tōrath hamminḥāh haqrēv ʾōthāhh bənē-ʾaharōn lifnē ʾadhōnāi ʾel-pənē hammizbēaḥ
English: And this is the law of the meat offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the LORD, before the altar.

Hebrew: וְהֵרִ֨ים מִמֶּ֜נּוּ בְּקֻמְצ֗וֹ מִסֹּ֤לֶת הַמִּנְחָה֙ וּמִשַּׁמְנָ֔הּ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הַלְּבֹנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּנְחָ֑ה וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ רֵ֧יחַ נִיחֹ֛חַ אַזְכָּרָתָ֖הּ לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəhērîm mimmennū bəqumətṣō missōleth hamminḥāh ūmisshamnāhh vəʾēth kol-halləvōnāh ʾasher ʿal-hamminḥāh vəhiqṭîr hammizbēaḥ rēaḥ nîḥōaḥ ʾazkārāthāhh laʾdhōnāi
English: And he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which is upon the meat offering, and shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savour, even the memorial of it, unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתֶ֣רֶת מִמֶּ֔נָּה יֹאכְל֖וּ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֑יו מַצּ֤וֹת תֵּֽאָכֵל֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָדֹ֔שׁ בַּחֲצַ֥ר אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד יֹאכְלֽוּהָ׃
Translit: vəhannōthereth mimmennāh yōʾkhəlū ʾaharōn ūvānāv matṣṣōth tēʾākhēl bəmāqōm qādhōsh baḥatṣar ʾōhel-mōʿēdh yōʾkhəlūhā
English: And the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: with unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.

Hebrew: לֹ֤א תֵאָפֶה֙ חָמֵ֔ץ חֶלְקָ֛ם נָתַ֥תִּי אֹתָ֖הּ מֵאִשָּׁ֑י קֹ֤דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁים֙ הִ֔וא כַּחַטָּ֖את וְכָאָשָֽׁם׃
Translit: lōʾ thēʾāfeh ḥāmētṣ ḥelqām nāthattî ʾōthāhh mēʾisshāi qōdhesh qodhāshîm hivʾ kaḥaṭṭāʾth vəkhāʾāshām
English: It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it unto them for their portion of my offerings made by fire; it is most holy, as is the sin offering, and as the trespass offering.

Hebrew: כָּל־זָכָ֞ר בִּבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ יֹֽאכֲלֶ֔נָּה חָק־עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם מֵאִשֵּׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֥ע בָּהֶ֖ם יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translit: kol-zākhār bivnē ʾaharōn yōʾkhalennāh ḥoq-ʿōlām lədhōrōthēkhem mēʾisshē ʾadhōnāi kōl ʾasher-yiggaʿ bāhem yiqdāsh
English: All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the LORD made by fire: every one that toucheth them shall be holy.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: זֶ֡ה קָרְבַּן֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן וּבָנָ֜יו אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֣יבוּ לַֽיהוָ֗ה בְּיוֹם֙ הִמָּשַׁ֣ח אֹת֔וֹ עֲשִׂירִ֨ת הָאֵפָ֥ה סֹ֛לֶת מִנְחָ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד מַחֲצִיתָ֣הּ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וּמַחֲצִיתָ֖הּ בָּעָֽרֶב׃
Translit: zeh qorban ʾaharōn ūvānāv ʾasher-yaqrîvū laʾdhōnāi bəyōm himmāshaḥ ʾōthō ʿasîrith hāʾēfāh sōleth minḥāh tāmîdh maḥatṣîthāhh babbōqer ūmaḥatṣîthāhh bāʿārev
English: This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto the LORD in the day when he is anointed; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat offering perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half thereof at night.

Hebrew: עַֽל־מַחֲבַ֗ת בַּשֶּׁ֛מֶן תֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה מֻרְבֶּ֣כֶת תְּבִיאֶ֑נָּה תֻּפִינֵי֙ מִנְחַ֣ת פִּתִּ֔ים תַּקְרִ֥יב רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: ʿal-maḥavath basshemen tēʿāseh murəbekheth təvîʾennāh tufînē minḥath pittîm taqrîv rēaḥ-nîḥōaḥ laʾdhōnāi
English: In a pan it shall be made with oil; and when it is baken, thou shalt bring it in: and the baken pieces of the meat offering shalt thou offer for a sweet savour unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֵ֨ן הַמָּשִׁ֧יחַ תַּחְתָּ֛יו מִבָּנָ֖יו יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ חָק־עוֹלָ֕ם לַיהוָ֖ה כָּלִ֥יל תָּקְטָֽר׃
Translit: vəhakkōhēn hammāshîaḥ taḥtāv mibbānāv yaʿaseh ʾōthāhh ḥoq-ʿōlām laʾdhōnāi kālîl toqṭār
English: And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: it is a statute for ever unto the LORD; it shall be wholly burnt.

Hebrew: וְכָל־מִנְחַ֥ת כֹּהֵ֛ן כָּלִ֥יל תִּהְיֶ֖ה לֹ֥א תֵאָכֵֽל׃
Translit: vəkhol-minḥath kōhēn kālîl tihyeh lōʾ thēʾākhēl
English: For every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt: it shall not be eaten.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֤ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַֽחַטָּ֑את בִּמְק֡וֹם אֲשֶׁר֩ תִּשָּׁחֵ֨ט הָעֹלָ֜ה תִּשָּׁחֵ֤ט הַֽחַטָּאת֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִֽוא׃
Translit: dabbēr ʾel-ʾaharōn vəʾel-bānāv lēʾmōr zōʾth tōrath haḥaṭṭāʾth bimqōm ʾasher tisshāḥēṭ hāʿōlāh tisshāḥēṭ haḥaṭṭāʾth lifnē ʾadhōnāi qōdhesh qodhāshîm hivʾ
English: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the LORD: it is most holy.

Hebrew: הַכֹּהֵ֛ן הַֽמְחַטֵּ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ יֹאכֲלֶ֑נָּה בְּמָק֤וֹם קָדֹשׁ֙ תֵּֽאָכֵ֔ל בַּחֲצַ֖ר אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: hakkōhēn hamḥaṭṭēʾ ʾōthāhh yōʾkhalennāh bəmāqōm qādhōsh tēʾākhēl baḥatṣar ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֥ע בִּבְשָׂרָ֖הּ יִקְדָּ֑שׁ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִזֶּ֤ה מִדָּמָהּ֙ עַל־הַבֶּ֔גֶד אֲשֶׁר֙ יִזֶּ֣ה עָלֶ֔יהָ תְּכַבֵּ֖ס בְּמָק֥וֹם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
Translit: kōl ʾasher-yiggaʿ bivsārāhh yiqdāsh vaʾasher yizzeh middāmāhh ʿal-habbeghedh ʾasher yizzeh ʿālehā təkhabbēs bəmāqōm qādhōsh
English: Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.

Hebrew: וּכְלִי־חֶ֛רֶשׂ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּבֻשַּׁל־בּ֖וֹ יִשָּׁבֵ֑ר וְאִם־בִּכְלִ֤י נְחֹ֨שֶׁת֙ בֻּשָּׁ֔לָה וּמֹרַ֥ק וְשֻׁטַּ֖ף בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translit: ūkhəlî-ḥeres ʾasher təvusshal-bō yisshāvēr vəʾim-bikhlî nəḥōsheth busshālāh ūmōraq vəshuṭṭaf bammāyim
English: But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken: and if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed in water.

Hebrew: כָּל־זָכָ֥ר בַּכֹּהֲנִ֖ים יֹאכַ֣ל אֹתָ֑הּ קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִֽוא׃
Translit: kol-zākhār bakkōhanîm yōʾkhal ʾōthāhh qōdhesh qodhāshîm hivʾ
English: All the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it is most holy.

Hebrew: וְכָל־חַטָּ֡את אֲשֶׁר֩ יוּבָ֨א מִדָּמָ֜הּ אֶל־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד לְכַפֵּ֥ר בַּקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לֹ֣א תֵאָכֵ֑ל בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשָּׂרֵֽף׃
Translit: vəkhol-ḥaṭṭāʾth ʾasher yūvāʾ middāmāhh ʾel-ʾōhel mōʿēdh ləkhappēr baqqōdhesh lōʾ thēʾākhēl bāʾēsh tissārēf
English: And no sin offering, whereof any of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile withal in the holy place, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.

Hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הָאָשָׁ֑ם קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəzōʾth tōrath hāʾāshām qōdhesh qodhāshîm hūʾ
English: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.

Hebrew: בִּמְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁחֲטוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֹלָ֔ה יִשְׁחֲט֖וּ אֶת־הָאָשָׁ֑ם וְאֶת־דָּמ֛וֹ יִזְרֹ֥ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: bimqōm ʾasher yishḥaṭū ʾeth-hāʿōlāh yishḥaṭū ʾeth-hāʾāshām vəʾeth-dāmō yizrōq ʿal-hammizbēaḥ sāvîv
English: In the place where they kill the burnt offering shall they kill the trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle round about upon the altar.

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־חֶלְבּ֖וֹ יַקְרִ֣יב מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֵ֚ת הָֽאַלְיָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב הַֽמְכַסֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַקֶּֽרֶב׃
Translit: vəʾēth kol-ḥelbō yaqrîv mimmennū ʾēth hāʾalyāh vəʾeth-haḥēlev hamkhasseh ʾeth-haqqerev
English: And he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards,

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֨לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַכְּסָלִ֑ים וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֨רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד עַל־הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת יְסִירֶֽנָּה׃
Translit: vəʾēth shətē hakkəlāyōth vəʾeth-haḥēlev ʾasher ʿalēhen ʾasher ʿal-hakkəsālîm vəʾeth-hayyōthereth ʿal-hakkāvēdh ʿal-hakkəlāyōth yəsîrennāh
English: And the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul that is above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away:

Hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֨יר אֹתָ֤ם הַכֹּהֵן֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה אָשָׁ֖ם הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəhiqṭîr ʾōthām hakkōhēn hammizbēḥāh ʾissheh laʾdhōnāi ʾāshām hūʾ
English: And the priest shall burn them upon the altar for an offering made by fire unto the LORD: it is a trespass offering.

Hebrew: כָּל־זָכָ֥ר בַּכֹּהֲנִ֖ים יֹאכְלֶ֑נּוּ בְּמָק֤וֹם קָדוֹשׁ֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הֽוּא׃
Translit: kol-zākhār bakkōhanîm yōʾkhəlennū bəmāqōm qādhōsh yēʾākhēl qōdhesh qodhāshîm hūʾ
English: Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it is most holy.

Hebrew: כַּֽחַטָּאת֙ כָּֽאָשָׁ֔ם תּוֹרָ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לָהֶ֑ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְכַפֶּר־בּ֖וֹ ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translit: kaḥaṭṭāʾth kāʾāshām tōrāh ʾaḥath lāhem hakkōhēn ʾasher yəkhapper-bō lō yihyeh
English: As the sin offering is, so is the trespass offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have it.

Hebrew: וְהַ֨כֹּהֵ֔ן הַמַּקְרִ֖יב אֶת־עֹ֣לַת אִ֑ישׁ ע֤וֹר הָֽעֹלָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְרִ֔יב לַכֹּהֵ֖ן ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translit: vəhakkōhēn hammaqrîv ʾeth-ʿōlath ʾîsh ʿōr hāʿōlāh ʾasher hiqrîv lakkōhēn lō yihyeh
English: And the priest that offereth any man's burnt offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he hath offered.

Hebrew: וְכָל־מִנְחָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר תֵּֽאָפֶה֙ בַּתַּנּ֔וּר וְכָל־נַעֲשָׂ֥ה בַמַּרְחֶ֖שֶׁת וְעַֽל־מַחֲבַ֑ת לַכֹּהֵ֛ן הַמַּקְרִ֥יב אֹתָ֖הּ ל֥וֹ תִֽהְיֶֽה׃
Translit: vəkhol-minḥāh ʾasher tēʾāfeh battannūr vəkhol-naʿasāh vammarḥesheth vəʿal-maḥavath lakkōhēn hammaqrîv ʾōthāhh lō thihyeh
English: And all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest's that offereth it.

Hebrew: וְכָל־מִנְחָ֥ה בְלוּלָֽה־בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן וַחֲרֵבָ֑ה לְכָל־בְּנֵ֧י אַהֲרֹ֛ן תִּהְיֶ֖ה אִ֥ישׁ כְּאָחִֽיו׃
Translit: vəkhol-minḥāh vəlūlāh-vasshemen vaḥarēvāh ləkhol-bənē ʾaharōn tihyeh ʾîsh kəʾāḥîv
English: And every meat offering, mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one as much as another.

Hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַקְרִ֖יב לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəzōʾth tōrath zevaḥ hasshəlāmîm ʾasher yaqrîv laʾdhōnāi
English: And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he shall offer unto the LORD.

Hebrew: אִ֣ם עַל־תּוֹדָה֮ יַקְרִיבֶנּוּ֒ וְהִקְרִ֣יב עַל־זֶ֣בַח הַתּוֹדָ֗ה חַלּ֤וֹת מַצּוֹת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן וְסֹ֣לֶת מֻרְבֶּ֔כֶת חַלֹּ֖ת בְּלוּלֹ֥ת בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translit: ʾim ʿal-tōdhāh yaqrîvennū vəhiqrîv ʿal-zevaḥ hattōdhāh ḥallōth matṣṣōth bəlūlōth basshemen ūrəqîqē matṣṣōth məshuḥîm basshāmen vəsōleth murəbekheth ḥallōth bəlūlōth basshāmen
English: If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.

Hebrew: עַל־חַלֹּת֙ לֶ֣חֶם חָמֵ֔ץ יַקְרִ֖יב קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ עַל־זֶ֖בַח תּוֹדַ֥ת שְׁלָמָֽיו׃
Translit: ʿal-ḥallōth leḥem ḥāmētṣ yaqrîv qorbānō ʿal-zevaḥ tōdhath shəlāmāv
English: Besides the cakes, he shall offer for his offering leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֨יב מִמֶּ֤נּוּ אֶחָד֙ מִכָּל־קָרְבָּ֔ן תְּרוּמָ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה לַכֹּהֵ֗ן הַזֹּרֵ֛ק אֶת־דַּ֥ם הַשְּׁלָמִ֖ים ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translit: vəhiqrîv mimmennū ʾeḥādh mikkol-qorbān tərūmāh laʾdhōnāi lakkōhēn hazzōrēq ʾeth-dam hasshəlāmîm lō yihyeh
English: And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation for an heave offering unto the LORD, and it shall be the priest's that sprinkleth the blood of the peace offerings.

Hebrew: וּבְשַׂ֗ר זֶ֚בַח תּוֹדַ֣ת שְׁלָמָ֔יו בְּי֥וֹם קָרְבָּנ֖וֹ יֵאָכֵ֑ל לֹֽא־יַנִּ֥יחַ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translit: ūvəsar zevaḥ tōdhath shəlāmāv bəyōm qorbānō yēʾākhēl lōʾ-yannîaḥ mimmennū ʿadh-bōqer
English: And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.

Hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֣דֶר א֣וֹ נְדָבָ֗ה זֶ֚בַח קָרְבָּנ֔וֹ בְּי֛וֹם הַקְרִיב֥וֹ אֶת־זִבְח֖וֹ יֵאָכֵ֑ל וּמִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וְהַנּוֹתָ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ יֵאָכֵֽל׃
Translit: vəʾim-nedher ʾō nədhāvāh zevaḥ qorbānō bəyōm haqrîvō ʾeth-zivḥō yēʾākhēl ūmimmoḥorāth vəhannōthār mimmennū yēʾākhēl
English: But if the sacrifice of his offering be a vow, or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remainder of it shall be eaten:

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֖ר מִבְּשַׂ֣ר הַזָּ֑בַח בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י בָּאֵ֖שׁ יִשָּׂרֵֽף׃
Translit: vəhannōthār mibbəsar hazzāvaḥ bayyōm hasshəlîshî bāʾēsh yissārēf
English: But the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם הֵאָכֹ֣ל יֵ֠אָכֵל מִבְּשַׂר־זֶ֨בַח שְׁלָמָ֜יו בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֮ לֹ֣א יֵרָצֶה֒ הַמַּקְרִ֣יב אֹת֗וֹ לֹ֧א יֵחָשֵׁ֛ב ל֖וֹ פִּגּ֣וּל יִהְיֶ֑ה וְהַנֶּ֛פֶשׁ הָאֹכֶ֥לֶת מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עֲוֺנָ֥הּ תִּשָּֽׂא׃
Translit: vəʾim hēʾākhōl yēʾākhēl mibbəsar-zevaḥ shəlāmāv bayyōm hasshəlîshî lōʾ yērātṣeh hammaqrîv ʾōthō lōʾ yēḥāshēv lō piggūl yihyeh vəhannefesh hāʾōkheleth mimmennū ʿavōnāhh tissāʾ
English: And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offereth it: it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.

Hebrew: וְהַבָּשָׂ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֤ע בְּכָל־טָמֵא֙ לֹ֣א יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל בָּאֵ֖שׁ יִשָּׂרֵ֑ף וְהַ֨בָּשָׂ֔ר כָּל־טָה֖וֹר יֹאכַ֥ל בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translit: vəhabbāsār ʾasher-yiggaʿ bəkhol-ṭāmēʾ lōʾ yēʾākhēl bāʾēsh yissārēf vəhabbāsār kol-ṭāhōr yōʾkhal bāsār
English: And the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that be clean shall eat thereof.

Hebrew: וְהַנֶּ֜פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאכַ֣ל בָּשָׂ֗ר מִזֶּ֤בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַיהוָ֔ה וְטֻמְאָת֖וֹ עָלָ֑יו וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translit: vəhannefesh ʾasher-tōʾkhal bāsār mizzevaḥ hasshəlāmîm ʾasher laʾdhōnāi vəṭuməʾāthō ʿālāv vənikhrəthāh hannefesh hahivʾ mēʿammehā
English: But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

Hebrew: וְנֶ֜פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תִגַּ֣ע בְּכָל־טָמֵ֗א בְּטֻמְאַ֤ת אָדָם֙ א֣וֹ בִּבְהֵמָ֣ה טְמֵאָ֗ה א֚וֹ בְּכָל־שֶׁ֣קֶץ טָמֵ֔א וְאָכַ֛ל מִבְּשַׂר־זֶ֥בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַיהוָ֑ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translit: vənefesh kî-thiggaʿ bəkhol-ṭāmēʾ bəṭuməʾath ʾādhām ʾō bivhēmāh ṭəmēʾāh ʾō bəkhol-sheqetṣ ṭāmēʾ vəʾākhal mibbəsar-zevaḥ hasshəlāmîm ʾasher laʾdhōnāi vənikhrəthāh hannefesh hahivʾ mēʿammehā
English: Moreover the soul that shall touch any unclean thing, as the uncleanness of man, or any unclean beast, or any abominable unclean thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which pertain unto the LORD, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר כָּל־חֵ֜לֶב שׁ֥וֹר וְכֶ֛שֶׂב וָעֵ֖ז לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translit: dabbēr ʾel-bənē yisrāʾēl lēʾmōr kol-ḥēlev shōr vəkhesev vāʿēz lōʾ thōʾkhēlū
English: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.

Hebrew: וְחֵ֤לֶב נְבֵלָה֙ וְחֵ֣לֶב טְרֵפָ֔ה יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה לְכָל־מְלָאכָ֑ה וְאָכֹ֖ל לֹ֥א תֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
Translit: vəḥēlev nəvēlāh vəḥēlev ṭərēfāh yēʿāseh ləkhol-məlāʾkhāh vəʾākhōl lōʾ thōʾkhəluhū
English: And the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used in any other use: but ye shall in no wise eat of it.

Hebrew: כִּ֚י כָּל־אֹכֵ֣ל חֵ֔לֶב מִן־הַ֨בְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְרִ֥יב מִמֶּ֛נָּה אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הָאֹכֶ֖לֶת מֵֽעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translit: kî kol-ʾōkhēl ḥēlev min-habbəhēmāh ʾasher yaqrîv mimmennāh ʾissheh laʾdhōnāi vənikhrəthāh hannefesh hāʾōkheleth mēʿammehā
English: For whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD, even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from his people.

Hebrew: וְכָל־דָּם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכְל֔וּ בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לָע֖וֹף וְלַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translit: vəkhol-dām lōʾ thōʾkhəlū bəkhōl mōshəvōthēkhem lāʿōf vəlabbəhēmāh
English: Moreover ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.

Hebrew: כָּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאכַ֣ל כָּל־דָּ֑ם וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵֽעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translit: kol-nefesh ʾasher-tōʾkhal kol-dām vənikhrəthāh hannefesh hahivʾ mēʿammehā
English: Whatsoever soul it be that eateth any manner of blood, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הַמַּקְרִ֞יב אֶת־זֶ֤בַח שְׁלָמָיו֙ לַיהוָ֔ה יָבִ֧יא אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֛וֹ לַיהוָ֖ה מִזֶּ֥בַח שְׁלָמָֽיו׃
Translit: dabbēr ʾel-bənē yisrāʾēl lēʾmōr hammaqrîv ʾeth-zevaḥ shəlāmāv laʾdhōnāi yāvîʾ ʾeth-qorbānō laʾdhōnāi mizzevaḥ shəlāmāv
English: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrifice of his peace offerings unto the LORD shall bring his oblation unto the LORD of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.

Hebrew: יָדָ֣יו תְּבִיאֶ֔ינָה אֵ֖ת אִשֵּׁ֣י יְהוָ֑ה אֶת־הַחֵ֤לֶב עַל־הֶֽחָזֶה֙ יְבִיאֶ֔נּוּ אֵ֣ת הֶחָזֶ֗ה לְהָנִ֥יף אֹת֛וֹ תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: yādhāv təvîʾenāh ʾēth ʾisshē ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-haḥēlev ʿal-heḥāzeh yəvîʾennū ʾēth heḥāzeh ləhānîf ʾōthō tənūfāh lifnē ʾadhōnāi
English: His own hands shall bring the offerings of the LORD made by fire, the fat with the breast, it shall he bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before the LORD.

Hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֧יר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְהָיָה֙ הֶֽחָזֶ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָֽיו׃
Translit: vəhiqṭîr hakkōhēn ʾeth-haḥēlev hammizbēḥāh vəhāyāh heḥāzeh ləʾaharōn ūləvānāv
English: And the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast shall be Aaron's and his sons'.

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֔ין תִּתְּנ֥וּ תְרוּמָ֖ה לַכֹּהֵ֑ן מִזִּבְחֵ֖י שַׁלְמֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: vəʾēth shōq hayyāmîn tittənū thərūmāh lakkōhēn mizzivḥē shalmēkhem
English: And the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest for an heave offering of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.

Hebrew: הַמַּקְרִ֞יב אֶת־דַּ֧ם הַשְּׁלָמִ֛ים וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב מִבְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן ל֧וֹ תִהְיֶ֛ה שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִ֖ין לְמָנָֽה׃
Translit: hammaqrîv ʾeth-dam hasshəlāmîm vəʾeth-haḥēlev mibbənē ʾaharōn lō thihyeh shōq hayyāmîn ləmānāh
English: He among the sons of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for his part.

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אֶת־חֲזֵ֨ה הַתְּנוּפָ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה לָקַ֨חְתִּי֙ מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִזִּבְחֵ֖י שַׁלְמֵיהֶ֑ם וָאֶתֵּ֣ן אֹ֠תָם לְאַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֤ן וּלְבָנָיו֙ לְחָק־עוֹלָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: kî ʾeth-ḥazēh hattənūfāh vəʾēth shōq hattərūmāh lāqaḥtî mēʾēth bənē-yisrāʾēl mizzivḥē shalmēhem vāʾettēn ʾōthām ləʾaharōn hakkōhēn ūləvānāv ləḥoq-ʿōlām mēʾēth bənē yisrāʾēl
English: For the wave breast and the heave shoulder have I taken of the children of Israel from off the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priest and unto his sons by a statute for ever from among the children of Israel.

Hebrew: זֹ֣את מִשְׁחַ֤ת אַהֲרֹן֙ וּמִשְׁחַ֣ת בָּנָ֔יו מֵאִשֵּׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה בְּיוֹם֙ הִקְרִ֣יב אֹתָ֔ם לְכַהֵ֖ן לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: zōʾth mishḥath ʾaharōn ūmishḥath bānāv mēʾisshē ʾadhōnāi bəyōm hiqrîv ʾōthām ləkhahēn laʾdhōnāi
English: This is the portion of the anointing of Aaron, and of the anointing of his sons, out of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister unto the LORD in the priest's office;

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֗ם בְּיוֹם֙ מָשְׁח֣וֹ אֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
Translit: ʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi lāthēth lāhem bəyōm moshḥō ʾōthām mēʾēth bənē yisrāʾēl ḥuqqath ʿōlām lədhōrōthām
English: Which the LORD commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them, by a statute for ever throughout their generations.

Hebrew: זֹ֣את הַתּוֹרָ֗ה לָֽעֹלָה֙ לַמִּנְחָ֔ה וְלַֽחַטָּ֖את וְלָאָשָׁ֑ם וְלַ֨מִּלּוּאִ֔ים וּלְזֶ֖בַח הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
Translit: zōʾth hattōrāh lāʿōlāh lamminḥāh vəlaḥaṭṭāʾth vəlāʾāshām vəlammillūʾîm ūləzevaḥ hasshəlāmîm
English: This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meat offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecrations, and of the sacrifice of the peace offerings;

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּהַ֣ר סִינָ֑י בְּי֨וֹם צַוֺּת֜וֹ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְהַקְרִ֧יב אֶת־קָרְבְּנֵיהֶ֛ם לַיהוָ֖ה בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translit: ʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-mōsheh bəhar sînāi bəyōm tṣavvōthō ʾeth-bənē yisrāʾēl ləhaqrîv ʾeth-qorbənēhem laʾdhōnāi bəmidhbar sînāi
English: Which the LORD commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations unto the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: קַ֤ח אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו אִתּ֔וֹ וְאֵת֙ הַבְּגָדִ֔ים וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֑ה וְאֵ֣ת פַּ֣ר הַֽחַטָּ֗את וְאֵת֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הָֽאֵילִ֔ים וְאֵ֖ת סַ֥ל הַמַּצּֽוֹת׃
Translit: qaḥ ʾeth-ʾaharōn vəʾeth-bānāv ʾittō vəʾēth habbəghādhîm vəʾēth shemen hammishḥāh vəʾēth par haḥaṭṭāʾth vəʾēth shənē hāʾēlîm vəʾēth sal hammatṣṣōth
English: Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and a bullock for the sin offering, and two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread;

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה הַקְהֵ֑ל אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: vəʾēth kol-hāʿēdhāh haqhēl ʾel-pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: And gather thou all the congregation together unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַתִּקָּהֵל֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: vayyaʿas mōsheh kaʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾōthō vattiqqāhēl hāʿēdhāh ʾel-pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him; and the assembly was gathered together unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָעֵדָ֑ה זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-hāʿēdhāh zeh haddāvār ʾasher-tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi laʿasōth
English: And Moses said unto the congregation, This is the thing which the LORD commanded to be done.

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֣ב מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑יו וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyaqrēv mōsheh ʾeth-ʾaharōn vəʾeth-bānāv vayyirḥatṣ ʾōthām bammāyim
English: And Moses brought Aaron and his sons, and washed them with water.

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן עָלָ֜יו אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֗נֶת וַיַּחְגֹּ֤ר אֹתוֹ֙ בָּֽאַבְנֵ֔ט וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶֽת־הַמְּעִ֔יל וַיִּתֵּ֥ן עָלָ֖יו אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד וַיַּחְגֹּ֣ר אֹת֗וֹ בְּחֵ֨שֶׁב֙ הָֽאֵפֹ֔ד וַיֶּאְפֹּ֥ד ל֖וֹ בּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyittēn ʿālāv ʾeth-hakkuttōneth vayyaḥgōr ʾōthō bāʾavnēṭ vayyalbēsh ʾōthō ʾeth-hamməʿîl vayyittēn ʿālāv ʾeth-hāʾēfōdh vayyaḥgōr ʾōthō bəḥēshev hāʾēfōdh vayyeʾpōdh lō bō
English: And he put upon him the coat, and girded him with the girdle, and clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod upon him, and he girded him with the curious girdle of the ephod, and bound it unto him therewith.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם עָלָ֖יו אֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶל־הַחֹ֔שֶׁן אֶת־הָאוּרִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַתֻּמִּֽים׃
Translit: vayyāsem ʿālāv ʾeth-haḥōshen vayyittēn ʾel-haḥōshen ʾeth-hāʾūrîm vəʾeth-hattummîm
English: And he put the breastplate upon him: also he put in the breastplate the Urim and the Thummim.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיָּ֨שֶׂם עַֽל־הַמִּצְנֶ֜פֶת אֶל־מ֣וּל פָּנָ֗יו אֵ֣ת צִ֤יץ הַזָּהָב֙ נֵ֣זֶר הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyāsem ʾeth-hammitṣnefeth ʿal-rōʾshō vayyāsem ʿal-hammitṣnefeth ʾel-mūl pānāv ʾēth tṣîtṣ hazzāhāv nēzer haqqōdhesh kaʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-mōsheh
English: And he put the mitre upon his head; also upon the mitre, even upon his forefront, did he put the golden plate, the holy crown; as the LORD commanded Moses.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וַיִּמְשַׁ֥ח אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ʾeth-shemen hammishḥāh vayyimshaḥ ʾeth-hammishkān vəʾeth-kol-ʾasher-bō vayqaddēsh ʾōthām
English: And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was therein, and sanctified them.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥ז מִמֶּ֛נּוּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וַיִּמְשַׁ֨ח אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֜חַ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֗יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֛ר וְאֶת־כַּנּ֖וֹ לְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
Translit: vayyaz mimmennū ʿal-hammizbēaḥ shevaʿ pəʿāmîm vayyimshaḥ ʾeth-hammizbēaḥ vəʾeth-kol-kēlāv vəʾeth-hakkiyyōr vəʾeth-kannō ləqaddəshām
English: And he sprinkled thereof upon the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all his vessels, both the laver and his foot, to sanctify them.

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹק֙ מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ אַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיִּמְשַׁ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃
Translit: vayyitṣōq misshemen hammishḥāh ʿal rōʾsh ʾaharōn vayyimshaḥ ʾōthō ləqaddəshō
English: And he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron's head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֨ב מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁ֤ם כֻּתֳּנֹת֙ וַיַּחְגֹּ֤ר אֹתָם֙ אַבְנֵ֔ט וַיַּחֲבֹ֥שׁ לָהֶ֖ם מִגְבָּע֑וֹת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyaqrēv mōsheh ʾeth-bənē ʾaharōn vayyalbishēm kuttonōth vayyaḥgōr ʾōthām ʾavnēṭ vayyaḥavōsh lāhem mighbāʿōth kaʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-mōsheh
English: And Moses brought Aaron's sons, and put coats upon them, and girded them with girdles, and put bonnets upon them; as the LORD commanded Moses.

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֕שׁ אֵ֖ת פַּ֣ר הַֽחַטָּ֑את וַיִּסְמֹ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם עַל־רֹ֖אשׁ פַּ֥ר הַֽחַטָּֽאת׃
Translit: vayyaggēsh ʾēth par haḥaṭṭāʾth vayyismōkh ʾaharōn ūvānāv ʾeth-yədhēhem ʿal-rōʾsh par haḥaṭṭāʾth
English: And he brought the bullock for the sin offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bullock for the sin offering.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֗ט וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־הַדָּם֙ וַ֠יִּתֵּן עַל־קַרְנ֨וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ סָבִיב֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֔וֹ וַיְחַטֵּ֖א אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־הַדָּ֗ם יָצַק֙ אֶל־יְס֣וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַֽיְקַדְּשֵׁ֖הוּ לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָֽיו׃
Translit: vayyishḥāṭ vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ʾeth-haddām vayyittēn ʿal-qarnōth hammizbēaḥ sāvîv bəʾetṣbāʿō vayḥaṭṭēʾ ʾeth-hammizbēaḥ vəʾeth-haddām yātṣaq ʾel-yəsōdh hammizbēaḥ vayqaddəshēhū ləkhappēr ʿālāv
English: And he slew it; and Moses took the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured the blood at the bottom of the altar, and sanctified it, to make reconciliation upon it.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח אֶֽת־כָּל־הַחֵלֶב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַקֶּרֶב֒ וְאֵת֙ יֹתֶ֣רֶת הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת וְאֶֽת־חֶלְבְּהֶ֑ן וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ ʾeth-kol-haḥēlev ʾasher ʿal-haqqerev vəʾēth yōthereth hakkāvēdh vəʾeth-shətē hakkəlāyōth vəʾeth-ḥelbəhen vayyaqṭēr mōsheh hammizbēḥāh
English: And he took all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses burned it upon the altar.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַפָּ֤ר וְאֶת־עֹרוֹ֙ וְאֶת־בְּשָׂר֣וֹ וְאֶת־פִּרְשׁ֔וֹ שָׂרַ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vəʾeth-happār vəʾeth-ʿōrō vəʾeth-bəsārō vəʾeth-pirshō sāraf bāʾēsh miḥūtṣ lammaḥaneh kaʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-mōsheh
English: But the bullock, and his hide, his flesh, and his dung, he burnt with fire without the camp; as the LORD commanded Moses.

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֕ב אֵ֖ת אֵ֣יל הָעֹלָ֑ה וַֽיִּסְמְכ֞וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translit: vayyaqrēv ʾēth ʾēl hāʿōlāh vayyisməkhū ʾaharōn ūvānāv ʾeth-yədhēhem ʿal-rōʾsh hāʾāyil
English: And he brought the ram for the burnt offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֑ט וַיִּזְרֹ֨ק מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vayyishḥāṭ vayyizrōq mōsheh ʾeth-haddām ʿal-hammizbēaḥ sāvîv
English: And he killed it; and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֔יִל נִתַּ֖ח לִנְתָחָ֑יו וַיַּקְטֵ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְאֶת־הַנְּתָחִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַפָּֽדֶר׃
Translit: vəʾeth-hāʾayil nittaḥ linthāḥāv vayyaqṭēr mōsheh ʾeth-hārōʾsh vəʾeth-hannəthāḥîm vəʾeth-happādher
English: And he cut the ram into pieces; and Moses burnt the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַקֶּ֥רֶב וְאֶת־הַכְּרָעַ֖יִם רָחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וַיַּקְטֵר֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶת־כָּל־הָאַ֜יִל הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חָה עֹלָ֨ה ה֤וּא לְרֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֨חַ֙ אִשֶּׁ֥ה הוּא֙ לַיהוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vəʾeth-haqqerev vəʾeth-hakkərāʿayim rāḥatṣ bammāyim vayyaqṭēr mōsheh ʾeth-kol-hāʾayil hammizbēḥāh ʿōlāh hūʾ lərēaḥ-nîḥōaḥ ʾissheh hūʾ laʾdhōnāi kaʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-mōsheh
English: And he washed the inwards and the legs in water; and Moses burnt the whole ram upon the altar: it was a burnt sacrifice for a sweet savour, and an offering made by fire unto the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֶת־הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֔י אֵ֖יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים וַֽיִּסְמְכ֞וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translit: vayyaqrēv ʾeth-hāʾayil hasshēnî ʾēl hammilluʾîm vayyisməkhū ʾaharōn ūvānāv ʾeth-yədhēhem ʿal-rōʾsh hāʾāyil
English: And he brought the other ram, the ram of consecration: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֓ט וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ מִדָּמ֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֛ן עַל־תְּנ֥וּךְ אֹֽזֶן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
Translit: vayyishḥāṭ vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh middāmō vayyittēn ʿal-tənūkh ʾōzen-ʾaharōn haymānîth vəʿal-bōhen yādhō haymānîth vəʿal-bōhen raghlō haymānîth
English: And he slew it; and Moses took of the blood of it, and put it upon the tip of Aaron's right ear, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיִּתֵּ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֤ה מִן־הַדָּם֙ עַל־תְּנ֤וּךְ אָזְנָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וַיִּזְרֹ֨ק מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַֽמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vayyaqrēv ʾeth-bənē ʾaharōn vayyittēn mōsheh min-haddām ʿal-tənūkh ʾoznām haymānîth vəʿal-bōhen yādhām haymānîth vəʿal-bōhen raghlām haymānîth vayyizrōq mōsheh ʾeth-haddām ʿal-hammizbēaḥ sāvîv
English: And he brought Aaron's sons, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumbs of their right hands, and upon the great toes of their right feet: and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב וְאֶת־הָֽאַלְיָ֗ה וְאֶֽת־כָּל־הַחֵלֶב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַקֶּרֶב֒ וְאֵת֙ יֹתֶ֣רֶת הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת וְאֶֽת־חֶלְבְּהֶ֑ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִֽין׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ ʾeth-haḥēlev vəʾeth-hāʾalyāh vəʾeth-kol-haḥēlev ʾasher ʿal-haqqerev vəʾēth yōthereth hakkāvēdh vəʾeth-shətē hakkəlāyōth vəʾeth-ḥelbəhen vəʾēth shōq hayyāmîn
English: And he took the fat, and the rump, and all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right shoulder:

Hebrew: וּמִסַּ֨ל הַמַּצּ֜וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֗ה לָ֠קַח חַלַּ֨ת מַצָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ וְֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד וַיָּ֨שֶׂם֙ עַל־הַ֣חֲלָבִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִֽין׃
Translit: ūmissal hammatṣṣōth ʾasher lifnē ʾadhōnāi lāqaḥ ḥallath matṣṣāh ʾaḥath vəḥallath leḥem shemen ʾaḥath vərāqîq ʾeḥādh vayyāsem ʿal-haḥalāvîm vəʿal shōq hayyāmîn
English: And out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before the LORD, he took one unleavened cake, and a cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and put them on the fat, and upon the right shoulder:

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶת־הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וַיָּ֧נֶף אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyittēn ʾeth-hakkōl ʿal kappē ʾaharōn vəʿal kappē vānāv vayyānef ʾōthām tənūfāh lifnē ʾadhōnāi
English: And he put all upon Aaron's hands, and upon his sons' hands, and waved them for a wave offering before the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֹתָם֙ מֵעַ֣ל כַּפֵּיהֶ֔ם וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה מִלֻּאִ֥ים הֵם֙ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ʾōthām mēʿal kappēhem vayyaqṭēr hammizbēḥāh ʿal-hāʿōlāh milluʾîm hēm lərēaḥ nîḥōaḥ ʾissheh hūʾ laʾdhōnāi
English: And Moses took them from off their hands, and burnt them on the altar upon the burnt offering: they were consecrations for a sweet savour: it is an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הֶ֣חָזֶ֔ה וַיְנִיפֵ֥הוּ תְנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה מֵאֵ֣יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֗ים לְמֹשֶׁ֤ה הָיָה֙ לְמָנָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ʾeth-heḥāzeh vaynîfēhū thənūfāh lifnē ʾadhōnāi mēʾēl hammilluʾîm ləmōsheh hāyāh ləmānāh kaʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi ʾeth-mōsheh
English: And Moses took the breast, and waved it for a wave offering before the LORD: for of the ram of consecration it was Moses' part; as the LORD commanded Moses.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֗ה וּמִן־הַדָּם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּחַ֒ וַיַּ֤ז עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh misshemen hammishḥāh ūmin-haddām ʾasher ʿal-hammizbēaḥ vayyaz ʿal-ʾaharōn ʿal-bəghādhāv vəʿal-bānāv vəʿal-bighdhē vānāv ʾittō vayqaddēsh ʾeth-ʾaharōn ʾeth-bəghādhāv vəʾeth-bānāv vəʾeth-bighdhē vānāv ʾittō
English: And Moses took of the anointing oil, and of the blood which was upon the altar, and sprinkled it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon his sons' garments with him; and sanctified Aaron, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו בַּשְּׁל֣וּ אֶת־הַבָּשָׂר֮ פֶּ֣תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֒ וְשָׁם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וְאֶ֨ת־הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּסַ֣ל הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוֵּ֨יתִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-ʾaharōn vəʾel-bānāv basshəlū ʾeth-habbāsār pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh vəshām tōʾkhəlū ʾōthō vəʾeth-halleḥem ʾasher bəsal hammilluʾîm kaʾasher tṣivvēthî lēʾmōr ʾaharōn ūvānāv yōʾkhəluhū
English: And Moses said unto Aaron and to his sons, Boil the flesh at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and there eat it with the bread that is in the basket of consecrations, as I commanded, saying, Aaron and his sons shall eat it.

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֥ר בַּבָּשָׂ֖ר וּבַלָּ֑חֶם בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
Translit: vəhannōthār babbāsār ūvallāḥem bāʾēsh tisrōfū
English: And that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire.

Hebrew: וּמִפֶּתַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד לֹ֤א תֵֽצְאוּ֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים עַ֚ד י֣וֹם מְלֹ֔את יְמֵ֖י מִלֻּאֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים יְמַלֵּ֖א אֶת־יֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translit: ūmippethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh lōʾ thētṣəʾū shivʿath yāmîm ʿadh yōm məlōʾth yəmē milluʾēkhem kî shivʿath yāmîm yəmallēʾ ʾeth-yedhkhem
English: And ye shall not go out of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation in seven days, until the days of your consecration be at an end: for seven days shall he consecrate you.

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה לַעֲשֹׂ֖ת לְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: kaʾasher ʿāsāh bayyōm hazzeh tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi laʿasōth ləkhappēr ʿalēkhem
English: As he hath done this day, so the LORD hath commanded to do, to make an atonement for you.

Hebrew: וּפֶתַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד תֵּשְׁב֨וּ יוֹמָ֤ם וָלַ֨יְלָה֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֛ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת יְהוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תָמ֑וּתוּ כִּי־כֵ֖ן צֻוֵּֽיתִי׃
Translit: ūfethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh tēshəvū yōmām vālaylāh shivʿath yāmîm ūshəmartem ʾeth-mishmereth ʾadhōnāi vəlōʾ thāmūthū kî-khēn tṣuvvēthî
English: Therefore shall ye abide at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation day and night seven days, and keep the charge of the LORD, that ye die not: for so I am commanded.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּבָנָ֑יו אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾaharōn ūvānāv ʾēth kol-haddəvārîm ʾasher-tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi bəyadh-mōsheh
English: So Aaron and his sons did all things which the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
